headline.main: Message Maven Finds Fingers Pointing at Him

docs.lead_paragraph: David Axelrod has felt the brunt of criticism over what many view as the administration’s failure to clearly define and disseminate President Obama’s agenda.
docs.snippet: David Axelrod has felt the brunt of criticism over what many view as the administration’s failure to clearly define and disseminate President Obama’s agenda.

headline.main: Reader Comments on my Antibiotics Column

docs.abstract: Reader comments (and a few additional thoughts of my own) on the way our farming practices lead to overuse of antibiotics -- so that they are ineffective against disease.
docs.lead_paragraph: My Sunday column is about the diminishing effectiveness of antibiotics, and the concern that our agricultural policies (stuffing livestock with antibiotics) will entail huge public health costs. The rise of antibiotic-resistance is well-known (it's a great example of evolution), and was recently documented by my Times colleague Andrew Pollack in the case of gram-negative bacteria.
docs.snippet: Reader comments (and a few additional thoughts of my own) on the way our farming practices lead to overuse of antibiotics -- so that they are ineffective against disease.

docs.abstract: The Labor Department releases its monthly statistics, figures that Republicans quickly pounce on as evidence that the administration's economic agenda isn't working.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite fears that the nation's unemployment rate could climb back into double digits because of the heavy snowstorms in February, the latest figures show that it remained nearly steady at 9.7 percent last month.
docs.snippet: The Labor Department releases its monthly statistics, figures that Republicans quickly pounce on as evidence that the administration's economic agenda isn't working.

headline.main: In Obesity Epidemic, What's One Cookie?

docs.abstract: Dr David Ludwig, Children's Hospital Boston Optimal Weight for Life program director, writes commentary in Journal of the American Medical Assn, warning that small changes in diet and behavior often do not lead to meaningful weight loss, because human body's adaptive mechanisms try to keep weight consistent; says that small changes are important as start to healthier lifestyle and health should be more important than actual weight; suggests that larger changes like regulating food advertisements and eliminating subsidies for junk food would be helpful in fighting childhood obesity; photo; drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: The basic formula for gaining and losing weight is well known: a pound of fat equals 3,500 calories. That simple equation has fueled the widely accepted notion that weight loss does not require daunting lifestyle changes but ''small changes that add up,'' as the first lady, Michelle Obama, put it last month in announcing a national plan to counter childhood obesity.
docs.snippet: The basic formula for gaining and losing weight is well known: a pound of fat equals 3,500 calories.     That simple equation has fueled the widely accepted notion that weight loss does not require daunting lifestyle changes but ''small changes that...

headline.seo: Obama Passes Checkup but Struggles With Smoking Habit
headline.print_headline: President in ‘Excellent Health,’ Routine Checkup Finds
headline.main: President in ‘Excellent Health,’ Routine Checkup Finds

byline.original: By LAWRENCE K. ALTMAN  and JEFF ZELENY

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors recommend that the president continue his “smoking cessation efforts” and that he change his diet to bring down a cholesterol level that is borderline high.
docs.snippet: Doctors recommend that the president continue his “smoking cessation efforts” and that he change his diet to bring down a cholesterol level that is borderline high.
